rundown: 1-2 L @ Philadelphia Phillies Bryce Elder: 7.0 innings, 1 earned run, 3 hits, 0 HR, 3 strikeouts Batters: Jurickson Profar (1 hits - 3 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) Matt Olson (3 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 0 RBI) Nick Allen (2 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 0 RBI) The Braves fell to the Philadelphia Phillies in a close game, managing to score only one run despite a strong offensive showing with 12 hits. Bryce Elder delivered a solid performance on the mound, allowing just one earned run over seven innings. Key highlights include: 1. Matt Olson led the offense with three hits, showcasing his ability to get on base. 2. Jurickson Profar contributed with a crucial RBI, although it wasn't enough to secure a win. 3. The Braves' pitching was effective, limiting the Phillies to only six hits, but they couldn't capitalize on their offensive opportunities.
